main event: Observer watched three brilliant lights in V formation travel slowly from horizon to horizon.
interesting points: The lights were brighter than the stars and between 2-3 degrees apart.
The middle light disappeared as the other two lights continued westward together.
The two remaining lights turned off abruptly, leaving the area in darkness.
The observer said the lights would not have been aircraft navigation lights as they were much brighter and the movement was unlike aircraft.
A light intensity measuring device was being tested in the area at the time, which may have produced an eerie effect from the ground.
sighted object: three brilliant lights in V formation
witnesses: A FAA air traffic controller from San Francisco International Airport
